alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 4:31PM EST until February 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Wells, Huntington, Blackford, Jay and Wabash Counties. Eel River at North Manchester affecting Whitley, Miami, Kosciusko, Cass IN and Wabash Counties. Maumee River near Defiance affecting Defiance and Henry Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Defiance, De Kalb and Allen IN Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne affecting Allen IN County. Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. Saint Marys River near Decatur affecting Adams, Allen IN and Van Wert Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Defiance, Fulton OH and Williams Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall led to rises on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of low land and agricultural land begins near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.9 feet tomorrow morning, then rise above flood stage tomorrow evening. It will continue to rise to 12.4 feet by Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
